{"step_by_step_thinking": "Resin teeth are a type of artificial teeth used in dentures. They are known for their aesthetic appeal and durability. However, they do not have a high compressive strength or high fracture strength. They are not contraindicated in patients with decreased inter occlusal distance. Resin teeth can show crazing, which is the formation of fine cracks on the surface due to stress.", "answer_choice": "C"}
